body:
Hai, so Im looking to to improve in pvp and i recently found this server and ive seen that it has some amazing pvpers so i was hoping that maybe one of you who is good at pvp or is just happy to help someone could train me in pvp?

Just put your Skype if you want to train me and ill accept u right away :)

Thanks!
body_tagged:
Hai, so Im looking to to improve in pvp and i recently found this server and ive seen that it has some amazing pvpers so i was hoping that maybe one of you who is good at pvp or is just happy to help someone could train me in pvp?

Just put your Skype if you want to train me and ill accept u right away :)

Thanks!

replies.body: First, welcome to the server, im new here too but i come from another hard-pvp servers so i can help u too :D
replies.body_tagged: First, welcome to the server, im new here too but i come from another hard-pvp servers so i can help u too :D

replies.body:
Kohi. That's all I need to say.

Watch people like Cayden!, StimpyPvP, Dualzz, PvPCD, etc. Those players play Kohi, and after watching how they do things you understand how it works. After understanding, just play nonstop on Kohi. This is only recommended if you get 70 fps and above. Kohi makes your game laggy af. If you get a lot of lag, go to Badlion and go to UHC FFA. People there are bad, but it will help your aim with a bow and arrow. Afterwards, go to ranked MCSG. That will give you better tactics to play with and you will be able to use a fishing rod easily. After that, Build UHC. This is basically where all the try hards are. Another good server like Avicus is OCN. People there are a lot better, and when I got temp banned for void logging for 7 days, I went there. When I came back, I was a lot better.

But at the end, it's all practice, practice, practice!

" s I he gets an idea of things"

So you're getting him into cheating, ok.
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
I have no idea where you got that idea from. You see, there's the MCSG PvP style, the Kohi PvP style, the UHC PvP style and the OCN/Avicus PvP style. At the end, the hardest but most  effective style is Kohi. I'm just telling him this so he can learn the PvP style; aggressive, yet cautious. I never said for him to cheat. And, just because I can.



That escalated quickly ;-;.

replies.body:
That's not entirely true.
Even though Kohi might seem to be more on the competitive side, each of those pvp styles have different aspects of it that makes it special. If you look at MCSG or UHC where you have to be able to use many items efficiently compared to pot pvp, it might seem more complex and harder.

replies.body:
Yeah, that's why I recommended those types of PvP too.

But if you want to get good at PvP fast, Kohi is the way to go. We don't get much fishing rods or fns in Avicus :P. And I can say that from playing only Avicus, OCN, and Kohi, when I hopped on to Badlion and did some ranked MCSG I got rekt :P. Same thing for BuildUHC. I used to be so much better :P.
replies.body_tagged:
Yeah, that's why I recommended those types of PvP too.

But if you want to get good at PvP fast, Kohi is the way to go. We don't get much fishing rods or fns in Avicus :P. And I can say that from playing only Avicus, OCN, and Kohi, when I hopped on to Badlion and did some ranked MCSG I got rekt :P. Same thing for BuildUHC. I used to be so much better :P.
